```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
m <- sample(10:99, 1) # mass (kg)
h <- sample(1:20, 1) # height (m)
t <- sample(10:30, 1) # time (s)

ans <- m * 9.8 * h / t # power (W)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\mathsf{\\,W}$", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```

Question
========
How much power is required to lift a box of mass $`r m` \mathsf{\,kg}$ a
distance of $`r fmt(h,1)` \mathsf{\,m}$ straight up in $`r fmt(t,1)` \mathsf{\,s}$?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```


Solution
========
Power is work over time:
$$P = \frac{W}{t} = \frac{Fd}{t} = \frac{mgh}{t} = \frac{(`r m` \mathsf{\,kg})(9.80 \mathsf{\,N/kg})(`r fmt(h, 1)` \mathsf{\,m})}{`r fmt(t, 1)` \mathsf{\,s}} = `r signif(ans, 3)` \mathsf{\,W}$$
